Class dom.serial.Data 

java.lang.Object
    |
    +----dom.serial.Data
Subclasses:
SessionViewData
public class Data
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
A serializable dictionary, that uses a Hashtable underneath. It is meant to be serialized, and so implements the Serializable interface. It is used so that DObjects (and the View itself) can have a generic data structure for sending arbitrary key (string) -> serializable object relations.

Author:
Scott Lewis
See Also:
DObjectPacket, SessionViewPacket
Source Code:
Data.java

Method Detail

put

public void put(java.lang.String key,
                java.io.Serializable element)
Put a new element in the serializable dictionary. Caller must guarantee uniqueness of key.
Parameters:
key - the String key for this element
element - the Serializable element to be associated with the given key. Should not be null.

get

public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.String key)
Get a serializable object from this dictionary given a String key.
Parameters:
key - the String key to look for.
Returns:
Object that corresponds to given key. If not found, null is returned.

put

public void put(int index,
                java.io.Serializable element)
Put Serializable element into this dictionary using an integer as a key. Caller must guarantee uniqueness of index.
Parameters:
index - the int index to associate with the given element
element - the Serializable element to add to the dictionary

get

public java.lang.Object get(int index)
Get an object out of this dictionary given an integer key.
Parameters:
index - the int index to use as the key
Returns:
Object that corresponds to key in this dictionary. Returns null if object not found

size

public int size()
Provide information about the current number of key->element mappings in this dictionary.
Returns:
int number of elements in dictionary

keys

public java.util.Enumeration keys()
Get an Enumeration of all of the current keys (Strings) currently in this dictionary. All elements of the Enumeration will be of type String.
Returns:
Enumeration of the current keys in this dictionary

elements

public java.util.Enumeration elements()
Return an Enumeration of the elements that are currently in this dictionary.
Returns:
Enumeration of all elements (values) in this dictionary

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Return String representation of this dictionary. Mostly used for debugging.
Returns:
String representation of this dictionary
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

minimalString

public java.lang.String minimalString()
Return a minimal string for this dictionary.
Returns:
String that is a 'small' representation of this dictionary. Just includes information on the elements of the dictionary, no information about the dictionary as a whole.
